RelatedSentence: Regularly visiting the doctor may drastically cut your risk of dying from the most deadly form of skin cancer , according to a new study .
Researchers reviewed melanoma cases of 251 white patients from 2001 to 2007 .

A1: health insurance and access to care
RelatedSentence: For the period studied , all of the patients had health insurance and access to care in a health maintenance organization .
The risk for death from melanoma decreased 70 percent for patients who had seen a family doctor or specialist at least once in the five years before they were diagnosed .
After controlling for other chronic conditions , gender , age and other factors , researchers found that visiting a specialist before a melanoma diagnosis may reduce the risk of dying by 90 percent .
After controlling for other chronic conditions , gender , age and other factors , researchers found that visiting a specialist before a melanoma diagnosis may reduce the risk of dying by 90 percent .
Access to health care may not be the only barrier to getting care , researchers said .
